parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From agapao; beloved.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pick out for myself, choose, elect, select. Middle voice from ek and lego; to select.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
And, even, also, namely.
From kleros and the base of nomos (reflexively) getting by apportionment); a sharer by lot, i.e. Inheritor; by implication, a possessor.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and the base of aggelos; to announce upon, i.e. to engage to do something, to assert something respecting oneself.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
